tweets.text: üö® Coinbase Insider Data Access Incident  Coinbase has confirmed an insider-related security incident involving a third-party contractor who improperly accessed customer data in December. According to Coinbase, the activity was detected by internal security monitoring and impacted a very limited number of users, estimated at approximately 30 customers. The contractor accessed sensitive customer information through internal support systems. Exposed data reportedly included personally identifiable information (PII) such as full names, email addresses, phone numbers, dates of birth, KYC-related details, as well as account-level information including cryptocurrency wallet balances and transaction history. Coinbase stated that the contractor‚Äôs access was unauthorized and in violation of internal policies. The individual was immediately removed from providing services to Coinbase. Impacted users were notified, offered identity theft protection services, and provided with security guidance. The incident was also disclosed to relevant regulatory authorities in line with standard compliance requirements.  #InsiderThreat #Coinbase #DataBreach #ThreatIntelligence

üö® ‚ÄúOpen Stealer‚Äù Open Source Stealing Software Announcement Detected üö®  A threat actor shared details about a stealing software project called Open Stealer, described as open source on a popular Russian dark web forum but not yet publicly released. The malware is claimed to be fully functional and capable of collecting extensive data from Chromium-based browsers and Firefox, including passwords, cookies, autofill data, browsing history, bookmarks, and stored payment card information. The malware also targets popular platforms such as Discord, Telegram, and Steam, extracting authentication tokens, session files, and configuration data. It also supports the theft of browser-based, desktop, and cold crypto wallets, along with comprehensive system profiling, including hardware identifiers, operating system details, network information, installed software, and active processes. The project reportedly includes a web-based management panel featuring logging, statistics, build creation, dynamic configuration management, encrypted communication, and Telegram-based notifications.  #ThreatIntelligence #Infostealer #Malware #DarkWeb

üö® Alleged Sale of a 0-Day Exploit Targeting a WordPress Plugin  A threat actor claims to be selling a 0-day exploit for a WordPress plugin used by over 4,000 websites. According to the actor, more than 3,800 sites are affected. The vulnerability allegedly allows attackers to send unauthorized emails from compromised websites, including both bulk spam campaigns and targeted messages through customizable templates.  #ZeroDay #Wordpress #Darkweb #Exploit #ThreatIntelligence

üö® Claim of Sale of Android Full-Chain 0-Day RCE Exploit üö®  A threat actor has announced the sale of a one-click, full-chain 0-day remote code execution (RCE) exploit targeting Android devices. The actor claims that the exploit enables a complete security breach without user interaction and is suitable for advanced attack operations.  #ThreatIntelligence #Android #ZeroDay #DarkWeb
